name: electricity production, coal, aluminium industry | electricity, high voltage, aluminium industry | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/13613/documentation

This is a dataset used to create an aluminium industry specific electricity market for European aluminium producing countries outside the region covered by the European Aluminium Association (EAA), i.e. outside EU27 and EFTA. The actual countries covered by this region are Russia, Montenegro and Bosnia and Herzegovina. The production volume represents the total amount of electricity from coal used in the region for aluminium production (electrolysis and ingot casting). The dataset also identifies the technology and country providing the coal-based electricity in the region. ;Electricity markets specific to the aluminium-industry are needed in an LCI database because primary aluminium production is very energy intensive, and hence the location of production plants is often determined by access to large amounts of cheap electricity, which often results in an electricity mix that is different from the general grid mix of the countries where the production plants are located. ;It is assumed that the production of electricity in general and in aluminium industry specific power plants is identical. Details on actual electricity generation with each technology can be found in the corresponding datasets.;The share of electricity produced using lignite and hard coal is calculated using both (1) estimates of the share of coal electricity coming from each country within the region 'Europe outside EU27 and EFTA'; and (2) ecoinvent v3.2 country-specific split of coal power plants between hard coal and lignite. The share of coal electricity in each country was calculated by distributing the total coal electricity used in aluminium production in the region (based on International Aluminium Institute [IAI] data for Europe as a whole and European Aluminium Agency data for EU27 and EFTA countries). The distribution is weighted by country-specific aluminium production volumes (source: IAI personal communication) and general grid mix in the respective countries (source: International Energy Agency). For ME, coal-based electricity is assumed to be 78% hard coal, 22% lignite (based on 'rest of world' data, i.e. on data representing all regions not covered in ecoinvent v3.2).;Calculations are detailed in the report 'Calculating grid mixes for the aluminium industry in ecoinvent v3', available on the ecoinvent website.

Re-labelling dataset, not representing a real transformation activity. Conceptually, the activity can be said to start with the production of electricity.

Re-labelling dataset, not representing a real transformation activity. Conceptually, the activity can be said to end with a given amount of high voltage electricity labelled as specifically used for the production of electricity.
category: D:Electricity, gas, steam and air conditioning supply/35:Electricity, gas, steam and air conditioning supply/351:Electric power generation, transmission and distribution/3510:Electric power generation, transmission and distribution

location.name: IAI Area, Russia & Europe outside EU27 & EFTA

processDocumentation.timeDescription: Production volume updated with 2015 data from IAI
processDocumentation.geographyDescription: European aluminium producing countries outside the region covered by the European Aluminium Association (EAA), i.e. outside EU27 and EFTA. The actual countries covered by this region are Russia, Montenegro and Bosnia and Herzegovina.
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription: For the split of coal-based electricity production to the respective fuels (lignite, hard coal), shares of different types of coal power plants in the countries, when available, were used as a proxy for the split relevant for the aluminium industry, else 'Rest-of-world' split (33% lignite, 67% hard coal) was used, see general comments.
processDocumentation.samplingDescription: International Aluminium Institute (IAI) data used for total electricity used in the production of aluminium that is from coal power plants. ecoinvent data used to split coal-based electricity production to the respective fuels (lignite, hard coal). The cited 97% representativeness is for IAI data (data based on 97% of regional aluminium production). The percent representativeness of data used to split coal based electricity production to different types of fuels (national grid proxy) is 95%. 5% of coal-based electricity is from Montenegro whose electricity production is not modelled in ecoinvent.

exchanges.description: Expressed as sum of contributing technologies (inputs) to allow uncertainty analysis: each technology share is uncertain, and in a Monte Carlo analysis will always be normalized by the sum contribution of each technology
